text: An intelligent and interactive tool to bootstrap new software projects from
dynamic, professional templates. It automates setup, letting you go from
idea to coding in seconds.
[bold]Interactive Mode (Recommended):[/]
Run without a project name to launch a step-by-step wizard.
[yellow]sniper-init[/]
[bold]Direct Mode (for automation):[/]
Provide all options on the command line for scripting.
[yellow]sniper-init[/] [cyan]my-react-app[/] [green]-t react-ts-vite --no-git[/]
[cyan]<PROJECT_NAME>[/]        The name for the new project directory (triggers Direct Mode).
[green]-t, --template <T>[/]    Specify the project template to use. [dim](Required in Direct Mode)[/]
[dim]Available: c-project, cpp-project, django-project, express-api, flask-api, go-cli, nextjs-app-router, react-ts-vite, web-static[/]
[green]--git[/] / [green]--no-git[/]          Initialize a Git repository (default: yes).
[green]--docker[/] / [green]--no-docker[/]     Include Docker files if available (default: yes).
[green]-h, --help[/]             Show this help message and exit.

content.text: Each template is a directory containing a `sniper.json` manifest. This file defines dynamic questions, post-initialization commands, and next steps, making the tool incredibly extensible. You can even add your own custom templates directory in the main sniper config.

text: [#] Launch the interactive setup wizard (recommended):
[yellow]sniper-init[/]
[#] Create a new Flask API project directly named 'my-api':
[yellow]sniper-init[/] [cyan]my-api[/] [green]-t flask-api[/]
[#] Create a static web page project and skip Git initialization:
[yellow]sniper-init[/] [cyan]portfolio[/] [green]-t web-static --no-git[/]
